# Hello!

This is an inline equation, where we can include things like $\Delta$ and $y=mx+b$. We can also have expressions on their own line:

$$
\begin{aligned}
f(x) &= \lim_{x\rightarrow 10} \frac{\frac{d}{dx}(x^2-5x-50)}{\frac{d}{dx}(x-10)} \\
&\stackrel{H}{=} \lim_{x\rightarrow 10} 2x+5 \\
&= 2(10)-5 = \boxed{15}
\end{aligned}
$$

# Importing Data

Now, let's read some data from our CSV.

```{r data}
# Read data from CSV file
# This is fake sample data. Find your own data.
data <- read.csv("data/sample.csv")
```

# Data Summary

```{r summary}
# Display the first few rows of the data
knitr::kable(head(data))

# Display a summary of the data
knitr::kable(summary(data))
```

# Regression Analysis

```{r regression, results='asis'}
# Add time squared to dataframe
data$time2 <- data$time^2

# Linear regression
linear_model <- lm(velocity ~ time, data=data)

# Quadratic regression
quad_model <- lm(velocity ~ time + time2, data=data)

# Add 'fit', 'lwr', and 'upr' columns to data (generated by predict)
data.predict_linear <- cbind(data, predict(linear_model, interval = "confidence"))
data.predict_quad <- cbind(data, predict(quad_model, interval = "confidence"))

# Summary of the models
stargazer(linear_model, type="latex", header=FALSE)
stargazer(quad_model, type="latex", header=FALSE)
```

\newpage

# Data Visualization

```{r plot, fig.cap="Data of stuff", fig.align="center", fig.width=4, fig.height=3}
# Graph of data, where x is time and y is velocity
ggplot(data, aes(x=time, y=velocity)) +
	# Real data
	geom_point() +
  
	# Regression lines
	geom_line(data=data.predict_linear, aes(x=time, y=fit), color="limegreen") +
	geom_line(data=data.predict_quad, aes(x=time, y=fit), color="red") +

	# Confidence intervals
	geom_ribbon(data=data.predict_linear, aes(x=time, ymin=lwr, ymax=upr), alpha=0.2, fill="limegreen") +
	geom_ribbon(data=data.predict_quad, aes(x=time, ymin=lwr, ymax=upr), alpha=0.2, fill="red") +

	# Labels
	labs(x="Time", y="Velocity") +
  
	# Theme
	theme_bw()
```
